intro: Dyschoriste humistrata, commonly known as the swamp dyschoriste, is a flowering plant native to wetland habitats in tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically alternate, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Dyschoriste humistrata thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in marshes, swamps, and along riverbanks.
